intro: Geonoma lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate geonoma, is a species of fern native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests and cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in these ecosystems.
